newsitem.title: JAPAN: Japan Sec limit lending of Tobishima shares.
newsitem.headline: Japan Sec limit lending of Tobishima shares.

text.p: A Japanese firm which borrows and lends shares said on Monday it would impose limits on lending of shares in Tobishima Corp.

Japan Securities Finance Co, which lends shares to brokerages for margin transactions with Finance Ministry authorisation, said in a statement that it would impose a limit on the number of Tobishima shares it lends.
The restriction will take effect on Tuesday, it said.
Brokerages borrow stocks from the company for clients wishing to sell them short in margin transactions.
The decision comes after Japan Securities Finance issued a warning to brokerages on March 4 that it may have problems lending Tobishima shares in the future.

The warning reflected current outstanding positions of Tobishima shares in the loan market as well as in margin transactions and had nothing to do with Tobishima's business performance, a Japan Securities official said at the time.
